line_1: Which serves to clear all sorts of cases,
line_2: And wears a masquerade of faces.

line_1: Thy glad approach my anxious bosom cases,
line_2: O MORN! I hail thy soft, enchanting breezes,
At various times, in various places.

line_1: Look like vile canker'd coins in velvet cases.
line_2: Hence stale, autumnal dames, still deck'd with laces,

line_1: And, as is usual in such cases,
line_2: Displacing all the things she places,

line_1: And, as is usual in such cases,
line_2: Making her cut most sad wry faces.

line_1: What matter for their different cases?
line_2: When each itself in t'other traces,
